The Shoreline offers serene views of Lake Erie: Apartment of the week
The Shoreline offers serene views of Lake Erie: Apartment of the week
CLEVELAND, Ohio – Downtown energy meets Lake Erie life at The Shoreline apartments.
The luxury apartment building sits on the edge of downtown Cleveland and on the edge of Lake Erie. Units have large windows full of sweeping lake scenes and the downtown skyline.
The Shoreline has some history behind it. The brick building was originally built in 1929 as the Nicholson Cleveland Terminal. The building was used to distribute both automobiles and newsprint, with multiple decks to load cars into the building at the same time.
In 1993, the land was purchased to create luxury apartments, and in July 2017, Landmark Companies acquired the apartment building.
Though the building is nearly a century old, it features a new pool, a fitness center, saunas and a complimentary Starbucks coffee machine in the lobby. For summertime conveniences, there are also a car wash station, a dog park and an outdoor grilling area.
“The Shoreline offers a one-of-a-kind living experience for its residents,” said Hannah Rohrer, a leasing consultant for The Shoreline. “The property features million-dollar views of the lake and downtown Cleveland. [It] provides a serene sanctuary to those who want the best of both worlds.”
One and two bedroom apartments are available. See the full listing here.
